intro: Maytenus myrsinoides, commonly known as the Mexican elder or Maytenus, is a woody shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
